msItem.title: ʻIbrat nāmah
عبرت نامه
msItem.note: Front flyleaf, recto: a) impression of small rectangular seal: Charls War Malit 1199 b) Presented to the Oriental Translation Com[mittee] by Sir A Malet Bart c) Brlist of Emperors from Bahadur Shah to Muhammad Shah, continuing to verso and in the hand of the scribe of the main text. Inside back cover, armorial bookplate of Sir Chas Warre Malet. A history of the Empire of Delhi from the death of Aurangzib to A.H. 1133/1721. Written for Ihtisham al-Daulah Nasir al-Mulk Mister Charles Warre Malet Bahadur Firuz Jang.

listBibl.bibl: For Malet's gift see the Transactions for 1830, pp. xxxiv-xxxv.

bindingDesc.p: Red leather oriental binding with flap, and stamped and painted decoration. gold-sprinkled paper doublures embossed with a floral design.

origin.p: 12 Jumada I A.H. 1202 and 18 February A.D. 1788.

availability.p: Visitors are welcome to consult manuscripts in the library by prior appointment. Information on access is available on the library page of the Society's web site at www.royalasiaticsociety.org and appointments can be arranged by e-mailing library@royalasiaticsociety.org
